name: Rann Riders Safari Resort

reviews.text: I recently stayed the hotel with my family. I was not sure whether I should go to this hotel or Shaam e sharhad village resort in Hodka, Kutch, as I liked there a lot lat time.
reviews.title: good value, but not great management

reviews.text: When I arrived the hotel, they only booked one room, instead of two. As they had many room sold already, we have to have two very separate rooms. Manager was not bad, he dealt ok. However, I did not really like how owner talked to me and blaming his staffs mistakes in front of me. The owner asked me ' who said that' etc to me. I did not want to get involved his problem into mine, as it was my holiday. I really felt uncomfortable fist day.
reviews.title: Comfortable and character-filled property with excellent naturalist guide

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The next morning. The breakfast was bad. They toasted the bread in advance. They should really have toaster on counter and they should us to toast the bread ourselves. Also the choice was very little. They did not have any indian breakfast. Compare to Lunch and dinner, I can not understand why they can not improve their breakfast bit better. Lunch and dinner were good for the price.(included in the rate)
reviews.title: Wildlife or village life?

reviews.text: Room was fine. average cleanness. Most of people is fine, but if you are super clean person, maybe this hotel is not for you. Please also be in mind that the hot water is only available between 5pm-8am. Also you have to run the water about 10 mins and you can get hot water. This kind of small things, they did not tell me at all. They should mention when arrive.
reviews.title: Loved the place:)

reviews.text: The great things were safari. We saw many pelicans, flamingos, cranes which were amazing for me. I also saws few wilds animals. The guides were good. Also the safari car was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: This is what we want!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The property at Rann Riders is beautiful, filled with animals (dogs, horses, chickens, ostriches, peacocks and many other birds), the garden is so well taken care of, the food is delicious, the bhungas are so comfortable and beautifully decorated, the owners and the staff are super sweet, attentive and prompt. We felt every detail was carefully looked after. And as if that wasn't good enough there is the safari to the Little Rann that just blew our minds. We really want to go back and spend more time.
reviews.title: Delicious!

reviews.text: Completely, 100% recommended.
reviews.title: Great Hospitality, comfortable stay

reviews.text: Spent three days at this place in the third week of january. The owners have a great team that makes you feel homely. Great food. Most important as a wildlife and nature photographer the Safari drivers are very knowledgable about the habitat, species and what a photographer is looking for. Would highly recommend
reviews.title: Amazing experience!!!!

reviews.text: We had seen the reviews here n left for our holiday n beleive me it was fun. The reviews n photos given here are really authentic, their hospitality is too good. If u love to be near nature this is the place. If u r tired of ur monotonous hectic life full of electronic gadgets around n need a break thn do visit here for a day. No tv no room service still u feel pampered n relaxed. Not to forget if u r a horse lover thrs a good stable right behind the resort with lovely horses. The food is also very tasty with good variety. Have a great holiday guys!!
reviews.title: Excellent resort, fantastic owner and knowledgeable guides

reviews.text: If you are in to wildlife phohotography and Little Rann of Kutch is a destnation then look no further-the Rann Riders is the place to be. Excellent functional resort nearby to the Rann and te safaris conducted by them are absolutely fantastic-the sarari driver is fantastically knowledgeable about the location of the wildlife/birds and also knows how th light should be for good photographer. All in all they will make your job as photographer very easy.
reviews.title: doing the desert with style

reviews.text: We were at the Rann Riders, Dasada in the first week of January 2012 alongwith our extended family (about 30 of us). The overall look of the resort is a bit rusty with a lot of components designed for comfortable stay but not quite working.
reviews.title: Disappointed. Even without expectations.

reviews.text: The rooms were quite shabby and the bathrooms ill maintained. Throughout our 3 day stay we could not get hot water as their was supposedly a wood-fire based boiler to heat up the water!! No intercom for connecting with the reception, No room service, limited staff.
reviews.title: A must stay at Little Rann

reviews.text: The food was good and the resort does offer proximity to nature and that's the saving grace. Definitely could have been better. For the price, I don't think this is value for money.
reviews.title: A real treasure! by Ana (Spain)

reviews.text: We visited this Rann Riders resort for a day during our trip to Little Rann. The experience had been wonderful from the time we called up the resort for the booking. Mr Malik, the owner, is an interesting person and seems to take lot of care of his guests. When we requested for the booking, he confirmed without any advance payment – even when I asked for sending some advance to him for my own comfort – his reply was “I remember your name, so why the advance?”
reviews.title: Warm hospitality and great ambience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resort has several kubas, a few bungas and a few rooms –the first two being traditional Kutchi houses. The reception office and the house alongside is decorated elaborately with traditional motifs. When we reached there, we were provided with two nice rooms – but we were disappointed – we wanted traditional huts and not typical modern hotel rooms. When we informed this to the manager Mr Ali, he was ready to help – with a little adjustment with other bookings he managed to shift us to the bungas – those were wonderful. Each bunga has one bed room, one changing room and a toilet. The traditional decorations – both inside and outside – are just marvelous. You don’t have to believe me - you can see them in the photos that I have uploaded.
reviews.title: Rann Riders – The ONLY way to experience Little Rann of Kutch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for five star luxury then stay away from the Rann Riders; if you're looking for something more rustic, homely and welcoming with truly great food and a warm friendly ambience then this is your place.
reviews.title: A warm welcome with great food and accomodation

reviews.text: The rooms are in individual roundhouse buildings each with their own bathrooms (in some cases exposed to the sky). Water supply can be a little idiosyncratic (you're in a desert area after all) and you may need to develop a liking for cold showers but, frankly, this is in keeping with the whole close-to-nature experience.
reviews.title: SIMPLE AND WONDERFUL

reviews.text: The Little Rann of Kuutch, close by, is simply amazing to visit both for the wild donkeys (Tripadviser censored the proper word!!) and for the birdlife (our own particular interest) as well as for the stunning beauty and desolation of the surroundings. Visit the flamingo lake for an astonishing experience. There are also some good birds to be found in the immediate surrounds as well.
reviews.title: Surprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back at the camp there are excellent meals produced morning noon and night. The masala omelettes at breakfast were as good as I have had, even though we wanted them at 06.15 for or early starts. Lunch was a selection of really delicious vegetable concoctions, usually with a chicken dish for those who favour meat (non veg) food, together with unlimited rice and naan breads. Dinner was another, different selection of vegetarian dishes, this time with meat being available from a barbecue/tandoori. Every one of the numerous dishes that we tasted was really good with a few being simply delicious.
reviews.title: a true oasis

reviews.text: Staff were friendly and helpful at all times and, most importantly, very relaxed and unintrusive - something that you won't always find in India - which made for a most enjoyable stay overall.
reviews.title: Truly an oasis

description: Rann Riders, Dasada is an Eco-friendly boutique resort with 28 cottages(Sgl/Dbl/Twin)offering cultural and wildlife experiences in the Little Rann ofKutch and surrounding rural areas. The resort comprises cottages built fromlocal materials in the vernacular architectural style. It offers wide-rangingmodern facilities for Guest. The resort has its own fleet of open vehicles forsafaris, indigenous breeds of horses including prize winning Kathiawadi andMarwari mares, and guides for bird watching, photo safaris and village tours.
